ch.bfh.ti.ostes2.gossip

Class ReplicationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.ti.ostes2.gossip.ReplicationManager

  • public class ReplicationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the ReplicationManager in the gossip architecture. It is intended to serve clients (computers, tablets and so on) via a Frontend concerning their QueryMessages or UpdateMessages. For each communication category (updating and querying) the tags from Utils are used to distinct them.
    Author:
    sosterwalder

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void listenToGossip()
      Listens to all available ReplicationManager neighbors for gossip messages using the GOSSIP-tag from Utils.
      void listenToQueries()
      Listens to all available Frontends for possible query messages using the QUERY-tag from Utils.
      void listenToUpdates()
      Listens to all available Frontends for possible update messages using the UPATE-tag from Utils.
      void printExecutedMessages()
      Convenience method for printing all executed messages within the configured logger.
      void processQueuedQueries()
      Processes queued queries (if there are any) as soon as they get executable.
      void sendGossip()
      Sends gossip messages to other, adjacent ReplicationManagers.
      void setLogLevel(org.apache.log4j.Level logLevel)
      Sets the internal log level to the given log level.

      • setLogLevel

        public void setLogLevel(org.apache.log4j.Level logLevel)
        Sets the internal log level to the given log level.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - the log level to set

      • listenToGossip

        public void listenToGossip()
        Listens to all available ReplicationManager neighbors for gossip messages using the GOSSIP-tag from Utils.

      • sendGossip

        public void sendGossip()
        Sends gossip messages to other, adjacent ReplicationManagers. This principally tells them which messages the current ReplicationManager knows and has in its buffer so that they can be shared.

      • listenToUpdates

        public void listenToUpdates()
        Listens to all available Frontends for possible update messages using the UPATE-tag from Utils.

      • listenToQueries

        public void listenToQueries()
        Listens to all available Frontends for possible query messages using the QUERY-tag from Utils.

      • processQueuedQueries

        public void processQueuedQueries()
        Processes queued queries (if there are any) as soon as they get executable.

      • printExecutedMessages

        public void printExecutedMessages()
        Convenience method for printing all executed messages within the configured logger.
